abstract.text: Creates a new authorization reference and provides an option to authorize or preauthorize rights.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to a set of authorization rights you create. Pass
if the application requires no rights at this time.
An
structure used when authorizing or preauthorizing rights.
Not used in OS X v10.2 and earlier.
In macOS 10.3 and later, you can pass icon or prompt data to be used in the authentication dialog box.
In macOS 10.4 and later, you can also pass a user name and password in order to authorize a user without user interaction. Possible values for this parameter are listed in
The data passed in this parameter is not stored in the authorization reference; it is used only during authorization. If you are not passing any data in this parameter, pass the constant

A pointer to an authorization reference. On return, this parameter refers to the authorization session the Security Server creates. Pass
if you require a function result but no authorization reference.
A result code. See

The primary purpose of this function is to create the opaque authorization reference structure associated with the authorization reference. You use the authorization reference in other authorization functions.
You can use this function to authorize all or partial rights. Authorizing rights with this function is most useful for applications that require a one-time authorization. By passing
to the

parameter, the Security Server attempts to authorize the requested rights and returns the appropriate result code without actually granting the rights. If you are not going to call any other authorization functions, use this method to determine if a user has authorization without granting any rights.
You can also use this function to preauthorize rights by specifying the

mask. Preauthorization is most useful when a right has a zero timeout. For example, you can preauthorize in the application and if it succeeds, call the helper tool and request authorization. This eliminates calling the helper tool if the user cannot later authorize the specified rights.
If you do not specify the
mask and the Security Server denies at least one right, then the status of this function on return is
If you do not specify the
mask and the Security Server requires user interaction, then the status of this function on return is
If you specify the
mask and the user cancels the authentication process, then the status of this function on return is
When your application no longer needs the authorization reference, use the function
to free the memory associated with it.

abstract.text: Secure the data your app manages, and control access to your app.
Creates a new authorization reference and provides an option to authorize or preauthorize rights.
An authorization item set designated to hold environment information relevant to authorization decisions.
The flags used to specify authorization options.
A flag that instructs the Security Server to revoke authorization.
A flag that permits the Security Server to attempt to grant the rights requested.
A flag that permits user interaction as needed.
An empty flag set that you use as a placeholder when you don’t want any of the other flags.
A flag that permits the Security Server to grant rights on an individual basis.
A flag that instructs the Security Server to preauthorize the rights requested.
Frees the memory associated with an authorization reference.
A structure containing a set of authorization items.
A pointer to an opaque authorization reference structure.
An authorization item set designated to represent a set of rights.
Use name tags to define authorization security items.
Recognize result codes specific to the authorization services API.
The user canceled the operation.
The Security Server denied authorization for one or more requested rights.
The Security Server denied authorization because no user interaction is allowed.
A constant you use in functions with an environment parameter if you have no environment data to provide.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
